key_points: President Biden announced COVID-19 vaccine mandates for U.S. employers with 100+ employees, federal contractors, and federal workers.
OSHA to develop an Emergency Temporary Standard (ETS) requiring employees to be vaccinated or tested weekly.
Employers with 100+ employees must provide paid time off for vaccination and recovery from side effects.
OSHA's ETS does not require a notice-and-comment process and will have immediate effect upon publication.
Legal challenges are anticipated, particularly concerning the rule's wage-payment requirement and coverage of workers who recently recovered from COVID-19.
Separate executive orders mandate vaccinations for employees of federal contractors and all federal workers, with minimal exceptions.
Federal contractors must comply with vaccine mandates as detailed by the Safer Federal Workforce Task Force by September 24.
Legal challenges to the federal contractor executive order may test presidential authority under the Procurement Act.
All federal executive branch workers are required to be vaccinated, with only legally required exceptions permitted.
CMS will require COVID-19 vaccinations for workers in most health care settings that receive Medicare or Medicaid reimbursement.
